answers.answer: Im 28 weeksStarted off at 145 now i weigh 167 :/I cant wait to lose this weight after i have my baby girl. ..im depressed too

I'm already over weight I'm 5'7" and started at 168lbs because with my first I was a cute 140lbs and then gained 50 with him then only dropped 20 lbs :/ never lost it he's 5 now. But I was 168 now I'm 178 only 10 lbs but I'm 22+5 and my doctor said to stop gaining so much because I should only gain 10-15 more lbs so I'm scared
I'm 24+4 and haven't gained any weight yet. I've been very sick this pregnancy /:
Im 5'1 pre pregnancy I was 101 now at 23wks im 124, when I was 115 at 20wks I believe the doctor told me to stop stuffing my face, lets see what he sais now when I see him in 5days.
I'm 23 wks 1 day an I've currently gained 5 lbs

Ok don't freak out about eight gain. Some Drs are just jerks. I started out my last pregnancy overweight and gained a whopping sixty pounds! My baby was beautiful and healthy and I delivered vaginally and epidural free.That being said, I'd much rather not gain sixty pounds again! But I'm trying not to stress over it and just eating healthy and exercising. Don't assume that you won't be able to have a healthy baby is you gain too much!

I'm 20w+1 and have only gained 11lbs after dropping 15.. So I am still regaining what I lost just slowly.Most women in a healthy weight range gain anywhere from 25-40lbs. However I don't stress over weight gain. As long as you and baby are healthy its all good!!Plus a friend of mine who is 37 weeks didn't start gaining till around 32. Don't stress! Just make sure you keep eating well.
Ps I'm 23 weeks and still haven't made it back up to my pre-pregnancy weight this time. I lost a lot with my morning sickness.

My Dr put my weight gain limit between 15-20 lbs this pregnancy. Most people think weight gain isn't a big deal but it can be. It puts you at a higher risk for gestational diabetes, hypertension, csections, and if you do need a section you're at greater risk for post op infection. Just because it doesn't happen to everyone doesn't mean it can't happen. Also gestational diabetes is a big deal because women who develop it are at a higher risk of developing type 2 diabetes later in life. As long as you're eating healthy and getting some exercise a little extra weight gain won't hurt. But its a very bad idea to think that just because you're pregnant you can eat whatever you want.
I've gained 6 pounds and I'm 5 months pregnant.

question: How is every one dealing with weight gain? I Was 126 lbs before getting pregnant. I'm 17 weeks 2 days and I'm 146 lbs now. That's 20 lbs in four months which is kinda depressing to me.
title: weight gain :(
